results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Min, Dolki
results.title: When the Alien From Space Is Both a Killer and a Gender Critique
results.abstract: In Dolki Min’s debut novel, “Walking Practice,” an extraterrestrial who crash-lands on Earth shows what it means to feel out of place in one’s body and its surroundings.

results.adx_keywords: Banking and Financial Institutions;Content Type: Service;Personal Finances;Stocks and Bonds;Deposit Insurance;Federal Deposit Insurance Corp;Securities Investor Protection Corp;Charles Schwab Corporation
results.byline: By Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard
results.title: Is My Money Safe? Here’s What Is Covered, and How You Can Do More.
results.abstract: The F.D.I.C. and other entities will protect most people’s bank and brokerage balances. But it’s as good a time as any for consumers to create other backstops.

media.caption: The line on Monday outside the former Silicon Valley Bank in Santa Clara, Calif., which opened under new auspices.

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Shipwrecks (Historic);Fashion and Apparel;North Sea;Netherlands
results.title: This Dress Survived for More Than Three Centuries at the Bottom of the Sea
results.abstract: Divers found an almost perfectly preserved dress in the remains of a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 1600s. Researchers are trying to figure out who owned the garment.

media.caption: An almost perfectly preserved dress was recovered from a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 17th century.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Admissions Standards;Women and Girls;Transgender;Women's Rights;Johnson, Paula A (1959- );Wellesley College;Massachusetts
results.title: At Wellesley College, Students Vote to Admit Trans Men
results.abstract: Students supported a nonbinding referendum on Tuesday that calls for opening admission to all nonbinary and transgender applicants. Opponents say the school’s mission is to educate women.

media.caption: Outside of The Lulu Chow Wang Campus Center at Wellesley College, on Monday.
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Friendship;Psychology and Psychologists
results.title: I Love You, Now Leave Me Alone: What Friendship Means to an Introvert
results.abstract: It can be hard to reconcile the need for close connections with the urge to cancel plans. Experts say it’s a matter of taking control and finding your comfort zone.

results.title: The Bakers Reimagining Traditional Jewish Pastries
results.abstract: By transforming once-kosher recipes with new flavors, shapes and techniques, chefs are innovating on, and safeguarding, time-honored breads and desserts.

media.caption: Clockwise from left: Edith’s ube schnecken and lemon meringue schnecke; K’Far’s poppy seed, brown butter and olive bourekas and potato and everything spice bourekas.

results.adx_keywords: Recipes;Soups;Vegetarianism
results.title: When Winter Meets Spring, It’s Time for These Vegetarian Soups
results.abstract: Parmesan cabbage, coconut curry sweet potato and a golden beet borscht: These three are heavy enough for a chilly day but light enough for spring.

media.caption: This Parmesan cabbage soup, golden beet borscht and coconut curry sweet potato soup let winter vegetables shine.
